meanings.definition: To look at or examine again.
meanings.sent1: She relooks at her homework to make sure it's correct.
meanings.sent2: He always relooks at his notes before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The detective relooks at the evidence and finds a new clue.
meanings.sent4: Her mind relooks at the memories of that special day.
meanings.sent5: The scientist relooks at the data to find any errors.

meanings.definition: To consider or think about something again.
meanings.sent1: He relooks the problem to find a solution.
meanings.sent2: She relooks the decision before making a choice.
meanings.sent3: The student relooks the essay and decides to add more details.
meanings.sent4: His mind relooks the events of the day, trying to understand.
meanings.sent5: The manager relooks the proposal to see if it can be improved.

meanings.definition: To give a second look or glance.
meanings.sent1: She relooks at the painting, noticing new details.
meanings.sent2: He relooks at the menu before ordering his meal.
meanings.sent3: The cat relooks at the toy mouse before pouncing on it.
meanings.sent4: His eyes relook at the beautiful sunset, taking it all in.
meanings.sent5: The child relooks at the picture book, enjoying the illustrations.
